issue.title: Avoid running `load` on the server unnecessarily
issue.body:
~~#5960. Just a failing test for now (have to run, will implement later if time allows).~~

Basic strategy:

* Track, in `load_server_data`, what gets used (`url`, `params.foo`, `parent`)
* Send that information to the client alongside `data`
* On navigation, when requesting `__data.json`, specify (probably in a custom header) which nodes have been invalidated (i.e. if a node uses `url`, it will always be invalid if the URL has changed; if it uses `params.foo`, it is only invalid if `params.foo` has changed; if it uses `parent` then it will be invalid if any parent is invalid)
* On the server, only run the invalid nodes, return a value like `-1` for everything that remains valid. If an invalid node _unexpectedly_ calls `await parent`, run everything upstream as well
* On the server, fill in the `-1` values from memory

issue.title: Invalidatation should always query the invalid server nodes with `fetch({ cache: 'no-cache' })`
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

During my work of the (simple) demo of PR #6265, I have found that the "TODO" items "get stuck" in the cache in IE11, after the demo invalidation.
After digging into Kit's code, I found out that the "dumb" IE11 ignore the request headers (specifically, "x-sveltekit-invalidated") if it hit the cache, so this is why it's less likely to hit this issue on other browsers.

I must have been explaining the issue terribley now, so I'll just explain what is wrong with Kit's code. In:
https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/05e8240150da446f6cd3c1f0feb4447408b2b43b/packages/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js#L716-L725
it's possible that the browser will use the cache, in the rare case that the header 'x-sveltekit-invalidated' matched to a cached request (or in the case we're on IE11 which probably ignores headers on caching), although clearly this target has been marked as invalid and must not be cached.

Solution:
Add `cache: 'no-cache'` as a parameter to `native_fetch`. This means that the browser will always query the server and check for the server response (even if it have cache), but allow the browser to cache the updated response for later. ([Source](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request/cache#value))
I'll upload PR soon.

Might be the root reason for the failure of #6354 and #6349 .

### Reproduction

Use the simple demo I mentioned on PR #6265.
You'll notice the wrong caching behavior while trying to add/remove items in the TODO list.
After changing Kit's code at the place I mentioned, it works.

issue.title: `invalidate()` does not cause +layout.svelte endpoints to load
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Expected: When calling `invalidate()`, the `load()` function will run for both `+page.server.js` and `+layout.server.js` endpoints.

Actual: When calling `invalidate()`, the `load()` function does not run for 
 `+layout.server.js` endpoints.

Was working in 1.0.0-next.443, now broken for versions >= 1.0.0-next.444.

### Reproduction

See below minimal repo that reproduces the bug, by having one counter on +page.server.js, and another counter in a `+layout.server.js` file.

https://github.com/oscarhermoso/layout-invalidate-bug

On page refresh, both counters increment as expected.

However, if you click the button to call `invalidate()`, only the `+page.server.js` counter increments.

Install previous svelte-kit version with `npm i @sveltejs/kit@1.0.0-next.443` to see previous behaviour working as expected.

body:
@dummdidumm @Rich-Harris fyi I'm seeing this again. After a successful login (with @auth/sveltekit), a call to invalidate("root-data") does not reload a root +layout.server.ts loader.

Oddly, after manually refreshing the page, it works as expected.

Actually, on further testing, it looks like my depends(key) was invalid. I had

depends("foo-bar")

rather than

depends("foo:bar")

after fixing that, it worked perfectly
